definition: lit. to shoot from both sides (idiom)/fig. to display ambidexterity/to slap with one hand and then the other, in quick succession/to use both feet equally (football)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)

sentences.english: He was hitting out right and left at his assailants.
sentences.chinese: 他左右开弓地回击攻击他的人。

sentences.english: A switch-hitter in baseball should be naturally ambidextrous.
sentences.chinese: 左右开弓的棒球运动员自然是两手都善用的。

sentences.english: Have your players to be able to use both of their legs in close-in shot situation( or" close-in shot").
sentences.chinese: 让你的球员掌握在近距离射球时能够左右开弓。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
a slap on the face/CL:記|记[ji4]
(coll.) a slap on one's face/a cuff
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to get out of the way
